name: Opez
long_description: Opez is dedicated to helping you discover exceptional service professionals. But who are these people, you might ask, and what are they like? Well, friends, let us tell you. To us, exceptional service professionals are individuals who consistently exceed your expectations in their line of work because they love what they do and because they love their customers.

name: Simmer
long_description:
Today’s delivery apps are bad experiences. First, you have to choose a delivery platform. Then, you scroll through dozens of restaurant and finally, you decide between hundreds of dishes. And even if you choose the right restaurant, you might get the wrong dishes.

On Simmer, we tell you the best reviewed dishes across all delivery apps. You first choose your dish on Simmer, and the delivery companies just take care of logistics. Through this, we are able to charge affiliate revenue for every order.

No one has done this before because determining a city’s best dishes requires millions of users to leave dish reviews.

Our unique insight is that all the data required already exists online, in blog posts, social media, newspapers. It just needs to be aggregated, analyzed, and indexed. We have built a custom sentiment analyzer to do just that.

Our vision is to be the first place people go when ordering delivery. 

The founders have backgrounds in engineering and data science from UChicago (their alma mater) and they have both worked at food tech companies like Lolli and Pops and Blue Apron.
one_liner: We do reviews for dishes. Our app helps users find the very best…

name: Cheers
long_description:
Cheers is building the operating system for in-person businesses, bringing the seamless efficiency of an Apple Store to every local service. We're starting with NFC-enabled employee badges that solve immediate pain points: collecting reviews, accepting payments, attributing customer interactions, and tracking performance. Our customers 5-10x their monthly Google Reviews.



- Imagine walking into any local business and experiencing the smoothness of an Apple Store: roaming checkouts, instant transactions, and personalized service - all from a tap on an employee's phone. That's the future we're creating. Our badges are the first step towards a fully integrated, frictionless system for in-person operations.



Most tech ignores field workers. We're fixing that. We're digitizing all operations for local services - from home repairs to restaurants. Our vision: tap your phone anywhere to close a sale, leave a review, or verify service, making every interaction as smooth as buying the latest iPhone.



- We have over 30 paying customers, including one enterprise pilot. MRR grew from $1,400 to $10,000+ in three months. We've processed over 3,000 reviews.



We're expanding into scheduling, payments, and full workforce management. Our goal: become the central platform for in-person work, serving millions of field employees and revolutionizing how local businesses operate.
